01vOU5S0ORaUCKuxLGD2eA.text: This is a decent pub, but it is really missing something, although I don't know what.  It was such a downer coming from the Lexington which is such an awesome, hopping, happening and yet down-to-earth place.  It is almost as if the Castle hasn't picked its personality or identity yet and so it is just a bit dull.  The lighting scheme also should be reviewed....

6-k_ihmRXD6MCe8s-LBpuQ.text: This pub is a good bet if you are trying to walk from Angel to Kings Cross, with a quick pint in between (which is exactly how we found it).  It's nice and clean on the inside, and has a good vibe.  The beers on tap aren't exactly life changing or interesting, but it's a solid choice in the area.

u8pTsLG5EFGgZnkNS_mspQ.text: The Castle is a nice place to go for a drink if you are looking for something like a pub but can't handle the sport tv on the back ground. It is very easy going, nice interior, clean and neat. That's about it.  They have a nice looking roof terrace but it was too cold to try it out and honestly I don't know who can handle all the Pentonville road traffic noise?Also I was a bit surprised when I received my bill from our drinks, too over priced. Maybe the most expensive place I have been for a while and it is just a pub after all? They do food as well but this time we did not have the change to explore the menu, and frankly I doubt if that is ever going to happen.

YFz5Uqd5g_gT5rQ5ZuVG6A.text: The Castle is a good little pub within walking distance from either Angel or King's Cross. Inside it's quite bright and bedecked with fairy lights (I think on a bad day this might be too bright), and there's a couple of cosy sofas too. It's nice to see Tuborg on tap; I haven't seen it on tap anywhere else in London yet and they've got Budvar too. The roof terrace is excellent and I'm sure will be rammed come summertime, but has no heating (good for the environment I suppose). The terrace has also got its own upstairs bar, which nicely sidesteps the problem of pint spillage on the way back up the stairs. Good fun but not sure the atmosphere was that kicking. Well, it was a Tuesday night.

8EeyyUBeXN-HxPLJ0rrKgw.text: Cool pub; nice and clean and attractive inside and out, but the beer is always flat and blah. I've actually never had a good pint there. It's really a shame because the vibe is great in there, so if you're drinking something other than draught you're probably OK, but I can't give it more than three stars if they beer ain't good! That said, I've been a few times for work related functions and we've always had a blast and those drinking wine or cocktails were all very pleased!

jPh__RDXf0n6rNCE4vyGxA.text: The castle is a great place to eat and drink, in my opinion, with a fantastic roof terrace which I think is the only one in the Angel.

KEfgC-MbE3cBIWhTsX-DyQ.text: Love this place! Definitely a go to. The bartenders are super friendly, great ambiance, and they got a really nice roof terrace. I literally come here at least once a week! Tried the burger, and yeap, it was a proper burger!

s7Ew235NmiKAE8QCdYJ3yA.text: They have a huge rooftop terrace which is perfect for the summer. I came here with here a large group and they were able to accommodate us immediately which was nice. We all had burgers that were just ok, but the atmosphere on the roof is definitely worth coming back for. I would come back for drinks but not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom

GAuRSLSQxFncc0XuRvVLPg.text: I walk by here all the time, but when it was 17 degrees in March, my friend and I decided that we had to find a rooftop terrace and this was the first place I thought of! Unfortunately the upstairs bar was not open, but we ordered drinks and snacks downstairs then brought them up. Many other people shared the same idea- it was a good atmosphere and I imagine it will only get better as the days get warmer.

Aye97cKSG882iPVfvITcmQ.text: We booked the roof for a work friend's leaving do, but sadly it rained that day! Thankfully the staff gave us some tables downstairs so we weren't caught out in the rain. The roof could definitely do with some sort of optional covering or some umbrellas over the tables though, because I probably would have braved it if we had a bit of cover, just to relax outside!The drinks are good though not cheap, but I expect that from most pubs in the area. The pub still had a decent atmosphere and the staff were friendly, and they had Aspall Cider on tap which makes me a happy camper. :) It was a Wednesday when we came and it was really really busy so I can only imagine what it's like on a Friday! You'd definitely want to reserve space if you wanted to bring a group after work hours.

wf7jtxPyZaMckLsUyYOEhw.text: Monopoly Pub Crawl - Stop #6 - Pentonville Road (Light Blue)Just around the corner from Angel is the Castle on Pentonville road. This charming yet elegant little pub offers cosy couches, a step up from your standard pub range, and some excellent little half pint beer mugs for a bit of variety. We were quite entertaining by the glassware (Grant got a mini-beer mug, I got a mini-goblet) and that helped set the mood. What also helped was a large padded bench we could relax on to ease our tiring legs for a few minutes.The bar staff are warm and welcoming and fully embrace the monopoly pub crawl with open arms. The Castle used to give out a bespoke monopoly card but sadly they've run out. That being said, the cute barmaid was happy to sign the board with a smile so we'll take that instead. I like this place for a bit of a different drink and in this case we had some cider on tap to give a bit of an energy boost. The food some of the more regular patrons indulged in smelled delicious so it may be worth a stop and I can definitely see me whiling away some cold winter nights here if I didn't live so far away.

DYDysNhw6JfTuu0rWdhLgw.text: The best pub in LONDON!! (Well Islington for sure) Always amazing company, lovely waiters, and a rooftop terrace. I especially recommend the fish and chips but The Castle really had a menu and reputation that can't go wrong. I've been to several pubs in Britain and really can only call The Castle my home! My mates and I love it, especially Genna! Make the right choice and stop in for a pint, you'll probably find us there!

Bo-p0DSpjkfn-eDgZiXxDA.text: The rooftop terrace on a sunny day makes this pub. It isn't huge or distinct, but pleasant enough. Staff don't rush to serve you and rest of the pub is nothing special...

x-Y6dIhC_3bKf4fU_JdnTQ.text: Cute bar, gets a bit crowded though and this is its downfall. Thursday, Friday Saturday you will struggle to get a seat. I've had to leave a couple of times as there is nowhere to sit and its not really suitable to standing. You can book tables though, which many people do. The roof is the best part , but it too gets really crowded. Plus as a non smoker, its a bit small and not particularly ventilated. The food is good, we had the meat platter and it was delish.

85Fdhp03Nw8NVQWeUUZ7GQ.text: Solid, but small menu offerings. A little pricey for pub food, but high quality. The beer menu needs some expanding. The interior is very cool, not your typical stodgy pub, but with more modern furniture and decorations. Excellent roof deck.

GJI2BT1_0bitHrUaRaCRHA.text: O, the Castle. I don't know if I've ever before had such mixed feelings on a pub. Located between the ever busy Angel and King's Cross areas of Islington, the Castle offers up a pretty standard drinking experience for the area. There is not much to remember about the interior - sparsely decorated without a coherent single motif, and the Castle's claim to fame would definitely have to be the roof terrace (at least in the summer). I will say, the roof is really nice, even if it is a bit crowded. And it is worth a visit to this place just to enjoy the terrace on a cool summer evening. Many people had the right idea of relaxing in the sun with a pitcher of Pimm's. The beer selection is what sort of kills the Castle for me. The best draught that was available was Bitburger, and that is not really saying much. I spent my evening drinking Stella, which cost an absurd £3,90 (especially when there are many other establishments in the area that sell Stella for £2-£3). All in all, nothing to write home about, but you should go enjoy the roof terrace, at least once.

0kMv6_goIGqty9o6OvO-EQ.text: It's a pub. Gas fires in winter, roof-deck in summer.Solid food - baked cheeses, salads, sandwiches, etc. Fancier than typical pub fare, but not completely OTT.Definitely a nice, relaxed place to spend some time.

1IpfXm-E3hqgDOsi0EIdsQ.text: The first time the castle caught my eye it was because of the cute bunting hanging in the window. If you know me well, you'll know I have a thing for bunting. Anyway the castle has a lovely rooftop terrace to be enjoyed when it is warm out, and fantastic mulled cider when it is cold. It is a bit on the pricey side in terms of nibbles, but the atmosphere is relaxed, and the service is always good.

AgmCfO-e6pqssbXJTRYu4g.text: Close to Angel tube station, The Castle on Pentonville road is exactly what I have come to expect from a pub in London.  As old-school boozers fade from the map this line of suave-looking gastropubs have rolled in to take their place and keep in line with the wave of gentrification.  As such you can probably guess what the Castle looks like; lots of neutral colour, 'arty' pictures and chalk boards attempting to blend modernity with a retro pub look; all that happens is it ends up looking distinctly average with nothing particularly alluring or eye-catching.That said the atmosphere here is one of well-mannered joviality.  The clientele and bar staff are generally very relaxed people making this a decent enough location to stop in for lunch.The food here is pretty decent albeit with a range that isn't exactly cahllenging.  Standard British pub food with a few salads all at very reasonable prices.  Drinks-wise there is a fair selection of wines along with a more standard choice of bottled and draught lager.Not bad but nothing out of the ordinary.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom

MQXC2VpBdh8FqbOLaDJojg.text: The Castle is a pub on the Pentonville road, close to Angel Islington station. The pub has two floors. The first is the main pub room with bar, tables and sofas. The second floor is the roof terrace.I've been to this pub a few times, the in the summer when I sat out on the roof. It was late evening and the noise from the street below wasn't too bad. It is a decent sized roof and there was quite a pleasant summer feel. Unfortunately, the inside of the pub, whilst being well presented, is fairly soulless in an aspirational Ikea kind of way. Nice in the summer, otherwise fairly bland.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom

SqTX1PXsOOGcTt-F_i7o4A.text: this was the very first pub I went to upon moving to london, so it has a special place in my heart! the castle is pretty small, but has a cosy atmosphere with a sun deck in the summer and fire place in the winter. The food they serve is pretty good and the prices for drinks are normal. I think it's a great place to go for a pint especially if you want to get away from busy upper street and shoreditch/hoxton.

-yWrxUhgVZBkQTLAIKyCuQ.text: Often seen it and thought I'd like to see what its like Unfortunately I walked into the middle of a pub quiz. I've got nothing against pub quizzes per se but I feel a bit silly walking into a pub in the middle of one, like I've wandered into a private party or something. Ordered a pint of T.E.A.and was asked if I would like it in a dimpled mug (serious plus points!). Theres a roof terrace (in the ramparts) which I would like to try some time. It's nice that it's away from the centre of Islington which gets a bit too heaving at times for my liking. I feel a bit stingy giving it a 3 but I was only there for one so I didn't feel I picked up enough of an impression of the place to give it any more. I'll head back sometime and see if it maybe deserves more.

mfTKzKtazKz2T3DLWFtdFA.text: I'm struggling to give this place even two, to be honest. I went down after they'd pimped themselves as the place to be for the outdoor Wimbledon viewing. So I pictured a spacious terrace, everyone with a view of the screen, laughing and drinking Pimm's. You know what, the upstairs deck is nice. Lots of reed walls and whatnot. And there was a bloke with a barbecue. My stars go to those two aspects! However, the telly was depending on a shoddy aerial, didn't have any volume, and then they took it inside anyway. Pimm's was ridiculously overpriced and I had to wait for them to go to the cornershop to buy lemonade to make it with. Service was utterly lousy - ignorant. There was no atmosphere - but why would there be? To top it all off, it rained. I know this is not their fault, but will unfortunately be my abiding memory.

r4nQSFAsKVJPCOn-Cn6SMg.text: As Mr Sunshine reluctantly takes his hat off as we near the 2 week British summer, I have found a pub that provides a charming brown chap, such as myself, with all that he could ever want to pass a few hours with good food, drink and friends. The Castle, which a short stroll from Angel tube station, has become a traditional place to congregate on the Easter Sunday for a roast and a debaucherous afternoon of cider and shots of Jägermeister. It is swiftly followed by an evening session of Lucky Voice (which I have also reviewed).   The Castle is cool without even knowing it. It attracts a clientele that simply want to be able to relax and enjoy the surroundings and good company. There is a wealth of seating both hard backed chairs at wooden tables and a scattering of cushioned areas. My preferred location and one I would recommend is the table to the left of the bar as you walk in. It's a good vantage spot for friends to see you and for ease of access to the bar. For me there are two standout features. The food and the staff. I'm not going to lie, the food is a little pricey, but you do get some of the most delicious food this side of the channel. I can highly recommend the Roasts. One of these bad boys will set you back between £11.50 and £12.50 which when you see the size of the portions is great value. The roast beef is delicious and cooked to perfection. Drinks too can be a little spenny. I discovered 'Crabbies' on Sunday, which I drank until I could no longer walk and talk at the same time., but with that came a rather hefty bill at the end. Bottled drinks can be 4 nuggets and up, but they also have a great selection of spirits and "Old Man Beers", which will be slightly less. The staff are fantastic and whilst it did help that the Danish girl that served us on Sunday was easy on the eye, the rest of the staff were diligent and largely tolerant of the constant requests for more food and drink. Added to this there is also a roof terrace which is perfect for the sun worshipers amongst you. In the summer it can get busy, so make sure you get down there early to secure some seating and bask in the warm glow of the giant ball of gas.The only smack on the wrist is the fact that a. The gents toilet looks and is as cold as a refrigerator and b. It smells like... well, it smells odd. If you break the seal, you're in for a night of stinky shuttle runs.  Having said this though, it's not so bad when you compare it to the hellish nightmare that is festival toilets. Either way, hopefully see you there in the coming months you sexy kids.

u0szPyl_t559suET3I0okA.text: My Mum and Dad spent the bulk of their last stay in this pub just to get away from the horrible Jury's Inn next door. On the few occasions I joined them I was quite taken with the place and impressed by the cosy feel. Generally the bars in Angel tend to fall down one of two lines- ultra modern expensive wine bar or old man grotty pub- so it was quite nice to find a happy medium. Drinks in here don't come cheap though and a round for four easily set us back £20 every time. The house wines were of a pretty good quality so I can understand paying a little more for them but £4.10 for a Guinness seemed a bit steep. Even though I've only visited this pub in the Winter, I expect the best thing about it is its roof terrace. Even from downstairs it looks quite inviting and I expect it would make a great place to lounge about in the warmer months. Given the prices of the drinks, The Castle is not a place I'll be back to often but hopefully I'll still remember it when the weather warms up again.

Kk5zFxmVplAx6B4Sa5Z86A.text: The Castle pub located on the busy Pentonville Road is great pub if you want a break from the busy centre of Angel.  The interior of the pub is nicely but unimpressively decorated - but as the other reviews have noted, the best part about this particular pub is the roof terrace.  With a lot of space, a lot of seating and a comfortable environment, it is a great place to kick back and relax during a sunny afternoon.  The noise from the road is hardly noticeable and the view is pleasant since you will not be able to see the cars.  The drinks are nothing to boast about since they are your average pub selection, but they do offer a good portion of fresh nacho platters.

hhuaf2Yz1l63YCyOXTz2eQ.text: Great spot, friendly folks and a great roof garden. This corner pub was right across from our hotel so the commute was A+. They serve pitchers, yes pitchers of Pimm's Cup with a straw in it. Nothing is more refreshing after a long day touring. I can't emphasize enough how friendly the staff is. The roof garden is a great place to enjoy a smoke, including a cigar. Crowd is eclectic & and the music suits the crowd...

PYwwmm8sStOLm5-CRXBWVQ.text: We are here last night- our last night in London- and it was a strange experience. Neat place as far as ambiance. The first 4 (!!!) things we tried to order they were out of, and once we finally placed an order they forgot my wine. The staff were very nice but not very on top of things. Food was a solid 3/5.

YMYLoQw_tRf7R0eZ4-27hw.text: I'm currently in London on vacation and we came here since we're staying at the Double Tree right across, we had the fish & chips w/ smash peas! It was good but the service wasn't, they never brought us our beers and never came to our table to ask if we needed anything. When we finally got up since they never brought us our bill, the beers that we never received were on the bill. I would have understand if it was busy but it wasn't.

JsXAQKL0xqga6PL1wMFhbg.text: Rose is amazingly awesome! We've been here several nights and if we weren't leaving tomorrow, we'd be here several more. Burgers were fine, but it was the friendly service Rose provides that keeps brining is back.

Qn0Di3EROwK6L5aNJBrI-w.text: After a day of travel we stopped here for a late dinner because we were staying at the hotel next door. After walking in around 8:15 and grabbing a table no one had come to give us menus or take our order for 45 minutes at which point we went to the bar to order food, only to be told the kitchen was closed. This place was secretly understaffed (one waitress for the bar and tables) and once a large group came in and ordered at the bar no one could take care of anyone at the tables. This place is probably better during the day with less customers and more staff. We didn't even get to try the food.

8sNm6bLMDsh4jF6ZayUNWg.text: This is a nice English Pub for some drinks and somewhat classic cuisine. I came with a larger group and our server was very friendly to us and allowed us to try certain items that were on tap before ordering them. He showed us an awesome New Zealand Apple/Passion Fruit cider, which was unlike the ciders you commonly find in the US.Since this was our last night in London, we wanted the cliche fish and chips - but to be honest it was one of the best preparations of it I've had. Enormous crispy filet of cod, with mushy peas and thick cut chips - a very nice meal washed down with some white beer. The proximity to our hotel and casual vibe made this place a winner in my book.Cheers.

8d3EOD1xW3MFpuVVKwZWmA.text: Came in to get dinner and the music was really loud. We went to leave and one of the ladies (possibly the owner) followed us out to see why we were leaving. She lowered the music and made it a very enjoyable experience. The food (fish and chips) was amazing. The dessert (sticky toffee pudding was the BEST dessert I've had in a long time. Sooo grateful she got us to stay!!!

0TKYh6R1OE-Aq9ELisFpzg.text: We finally made our way here, after passing by many times over the years.  We were looking forward to this place cause it looked like a cool pub.  It was ridiculously overpriced (almost £20 for a two drink round at a pub, not a cocktail bar).   What topped the annoying cake was the bartender didn't give change back.  Not worth the money, so many better places around Islington to enjoy!

g4Su0EdnU7assK2eVWFodg.text: Now this was actually a pretty cool pub, which was a change after visiting a bunch of other pubs that were average at best. In fact this one seemed to not only have an identity of its own, but it also has a rooftop bar, and not one of those small ones designed for smokers to be able to get their fix without having to walk out the front, but an actually, proper, Australian style, rooftop bar (and it was even large enough to sit a decent number of people). The biggest problem that I had was not so much the pub, because as I mentioned it is actually a pretty cool pub, but the fact that I really didn't have a huge amount of time to spend here. Oh, the other thing that I though was really cool was that this pub really takes advantage of it being a monopoly board pub, especially with the huge painting of the Pentonville Road card in the rooms leading to the toilets out the back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom

5joueRKP5n7cQo34T3CDag.text: Good beer selections, delicious British dishes and cool decoration. We had an awesome time drinking, making new friends and playing pub quiz.

QdulfO-6F1XlQIasWRpRhw.text: This was our first meal in London. We were so tired from all our traveling, just about anything would have tasted delicious.Atmosphere: A true standard pub. It was charming, cozy, and the bar was cute, but modern. It was however, super crowed and loud. We had to sit at the bar and wait for a booth to open up. There really wasn't much breathing room. When we were there the rooftop was under construction and it was off season, so we didn't get a chance to experience it, which seems to be a highlight in reading others reviews.Service/Staff: As mentioned above, we waited at the bar for a table to open. We did order our food at the bar because we were so hungry and didn't really want to wait. The bartender was very rude. I had some questions about what was in the food and he looked at me like I had five heads. Apparently in London, they don't get these types of questions. However, the time it took for our food to appear was reasonable. We had moved to a table at this point and they were kind enough to bring it over to us. Food: My boyfriend got the traditional fish and chips with mushy peas. He reports it as being good, but it is hard to compare because this, as it was his first fish and chips experience in London. The fish had crispy breading with flaky fish inside, fries were standard, and the mushy peas were unique and new experience. Portion wise, it was reasonable. Me, on the other hand, I got a Veggie Burger with fries and wasn't so impressed. It sounded really interesting, the burger itself was lightly breaded and it had a mint sauce with field greens as the lettuce. I dunno, the flavors were just off somehow. At least the bun was tasty. Oh, and I should mention the presentation was pretty cool. The burger came on a cutting board with the knife standing upright in the middle of the burger. The fries were in a wired metal cone, standing upright as well. I noticed they have taken the burger off the menu...Cost: Pricey. Don't go here if you are looking to eat (and/or drink) cheap. I don't think we will be returning. We were hoping to get a real pub experience but I don't think this quite met the standards. The food and drinks just aren't worth the price either. Would be cool to eat on the rooftop though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Veggie Burger with Fries
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Beer battered cod fillet and hand cut chips, mushy peas and tartare sauce
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. The Bar

bSEz1WjNlcTOINxxzVUqFQ.text: Came here for a drink while exploring London. The rooftop bar was really nice. Great place for a small group to meet up. Had a pitcher of Pimms that tasted great. A bit pricy.

cgKomXyQNTcTYtHWWjoK8g.text: A colleague of mine and I stayed the weekend in London across the street from The Castle. We made several visits over the weekend. Rose was there each time. Amazing customer service, good food and a fun vibe. I highly recommend this pub.

C9EUQeSMfGOqfmdLNKYwUw.text: Popped into The Castle on a beautiful Saturday afternoon around 5pm and the place was packed. There was no chance of grabbing a table on the rooftop so we opted for a table on the ground floor. The bartender was a complete dick, pretending not to understand a damn thing we said. Our order was simple - one Hammerton N1 and one Hammerton N7. After pointing out where the bottles were located in the fridge, the bartender handed them to us and told us the staggering price of £10.30.Having just been to an opening weekend at Hammerton Brewery and having paid only about £4 for a pint at the brewery, I was shocked at the mark-up. £5.10 for 330ml + it was served with complete attitude. No thanks.The icing on top of the cake was when I went to use the toilet prior to leaving The Castle. I was peacefully emptying my bladder when someone tried to knock down the toilet door, insisting that it was empty when in fact, it was not. I was in the toilet. The pounding and knocking continued for the duration of my time in the toilet which, might I add, was approximately 20 seconds.Rude staff. Rude patrons. Expensive beers.Won't be returning. Ever.

S6XLnuTNtiz7_aXKyGUe9g.text: This place is overpriced. The workers were rude. They took my drink away from the table when it was not empty. We were told to leave the terrace because it was closing but there were 30 other people who did not get asked to leave. (We were sober and there were many people who were yelling and falling over drunk so it made no sense why we were told to leave)

_UnCq7Z5VDrRNcmNqXqvTw.text: Have been there couple of times, standard fare. It is a better place in summer when the roof garden is thrown open with Pimms and the Bar-B-Q!!! Very crowded though and difficult to get attention of the staff. Resonantly priced and good ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom

4AkF1VYKausvrYDXwI62FQ.text: Nice place to have a pint whilst watching a match. It's a bit on the small side but when it's reasonable outside the roof deck is great with heating lamps. Burger and fries was delicious! In summer, rooftop is fun

F8x4na3MWPVez04pI-2T_w.text: The fish and chips here were everything I was looking for when I came to London. The beer and hot mulled cider were amazing as well. Super good service that made me come back!! Would recommend. Especially if staying at double tree (right next to it).

photos.caption: Photo of The Castle - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips!

sgYN5uWa-fN4-uSBizonBg.text: Love this pub!! Beautiful terrace garden on the roof - great for a summer's day. The staff are so friendly. For people coming here for the Monopoly pub crawl, it's worth visiting the loos (I won't spoil the surprise and say why , but definitely check it out). I'd love to come back here to have more of a relaxing, longer stop.

8-Oa_qmUArr-Ke9mJmAc0Q.text: Whenever the sun is out, or the weather is more outside-friendly, this is my first stop. The castle has a great house wine for a great price, which is what I always get with my friends. The staff is lovely and joke around with you, dance to the music, and are quick to serve you, even when it's full. The main reason to go is the great upstairs  terrass, which gets direct sun (when it decides to show up)! And if it's windy, they put up wind stoppers on either Side and put on the heaters so it becomes quite cozy! They even have a television upstairs if you are into watching sports! Once in a while they even have a live bbq upstairs for great prices! One of my favorite places in angel!
